comments.commentBody:
Stunning thoughtful work that asks of us all where are we going and why. and for those spreading their protective love over Turkey, this is not JUST a question of where Turkey is going, it is our deep shared human quandary.
thank you

Maybe this pictures seem "haunting" and "alienating" because the sky is gray in almost everyone.... New York too seems depressing with grey clouds but when the sun is out, it is one of the nicest places to walk around.

Just a thought...

Uau, how beautiful aesthetic! Intense story build with classic composition, decisive moment and innovative use of color.
THX,
wow... that looks more whorish/doll-like then attractive.
http://www.arango-design.com...

JCM maybe you have never heard of the words Art or Fun, do to the large stick up your butt. Michelle Phan is showing people of all genders to have fun with makeup. This kind of makeup people wouldn't wear in public it's for F-U-N like wearng it for halloween or people in photoshoots can use it. This has nothing to do with hiding what a woman looks like. I would rather you keep your nonsense to yourself. There was no reason for you to post a comment under her video so you can make a point that No one agrees with. So do us all a favor and don't waste your life writing a pointless comment under a wonderfull makeup artist video. Key word= Artist.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oYLDKzLFy8U
Maison Martin Margiela Artisanal 09 "twinning" from 2 years ago.
homage?
Bellota bellota?
Where's more? The interview felt like it just jumped off a cliff! I want more!
relax, its an artistic expression of Ms. Phan, seriously people

Makeup is artwork for the face. Sorry men, it's not all about impressing you. Just  like painting, I personally use makeup  as a way to unwind and express myself. For me, makeup is therapeutic.  I don't use makeup because it hides my face, but because it allows me to use colorful mediums to create a work of art for myself and others to appreciate.

JCM, I don't think you really understand. When I saw your comment I literally rolled my eyes from your obliviousness. Michelle is an ARTIST this is how her creativity MANIFESTS. She doesn't only do make up, but she's a painter as well. So it has nothing to do with men or attracting a mate. I'm an artist too so I can understand her vision. She even said it herself "I don't believe that makeup is the answer to making anyone beautiful. Or having the best bag, shoes, hair, car, or any material objects. To me what makes a person beautiful is their heart. Physical beauty can only last so long but what leaves on forever is the heart." - Michelle

I'm going to agree with v33chick that makeup is a hobby. At least that's what I think, I don't wear makeup everyday but when I do, I do it because I feel like it and want to do awesome effect with it. So far I've done some pretty epic things with it, even made myself look like a man one time for a show. Not to say there aren't women out there that believe that makeup makes them beautiful, there are women like that... but those women are the ones you should be apologizing to because they are the ones that have been oppressed, because none of the women here seem to believe that men are the sole reason to why were wear makeup. That's just plain arrogant...

I'm also younger than Michelle, college student really. -High-fives Heather-

Anyway, nice look Michelle for some reason it reminds me of Mirrors Edge. I sort have had my doubts when you darkened your eyebrows... I've tried that before... and it made me look angry. xD But over all it's pretty cool. I especially like the lips and the eyes part of the tutorial.

Living in Southern California, I can't imagine that city dwellers can't just step outside. We have a tiny 950 sq ft house with french doors leading off the dining room onto a deck that is about 400 sq feet. Even on a rainy day we gaze out onto the deck and see the outdoors just calling to us. We even put a small deck in the very back of the yard with flowering vines over it and a chiminea close by to have a fire any night we feel like it. There's an old fashioned mayan hammock hanging in my yard also. Any number of people can be napping at once! It is invaluable to be able to just step outside for a moment, an hour, an afternoon, an evening. Enjoy!
One of my favorite films is "In the Company of Men"......a great view of the seamy, hairy underbelly of male gossip and intrigue. Get it on Netflix.

I hope more of these articles appear praising those of us who enjoy creating wonderful impressions and beauty through wardrobe. The art of dressing, which was in itself a way of display and identification through most of society is all but a obsession for too few of us. Beautiful cloths abound in second hand stores and vintage shops in every corner of the globe. What a wonderful way to be green and wear items that have in some cases thousands of hours of hand work. To not blend and be lovely and original should be praised routinely and not thought of as odd. There are many woman I know who dress in wonderful cloths and present themselves in this manner. This should be a growing vision instead of the lackluster work out cloths and generic brands abound.
If the writer of this article would like a larger group of "eccentrics" to show the number of originals in this country, I would be happy to present a group of us who would oblige for the cause!

Please men, do not flatter yourselves. Women do not always wear makeup for you...

Michelle Phan is a youtube sensation...She has many videos...She has videos on how to keep your face healthy, facials, natural makeup etc. This is simply a futuristic look for makeup artists and day to day people to enjoy..

If you did not know, freelance makeup is actually a profession. Make up is an art and involves creativity and imagination. Please do not assume women simply use makeup to impress men. That is actually one of the last reasons women use makeup..
Makeup can change women's lives...It boosts confidences and above all of that is just really fun...

Dear JCM

Let me paraphrase the things that the people above me already stated: make up is a form of art, it's fun, this isn't a make up for going out (come on, would YOU even chat up a girl who wears this kind of make up?) and most women did it because it, once again, IS FUN.

Firstly, would you judge Michelle Phan like this, if she was painting on a canvas, or sketching on a paper? I guess not. Guess what? She is no different from other kinds of artists. It's just that instead of paper or canvas, she decided to use her face. Why is it that her art judged differently from other artists who paint on canvasses and papers? Yes, you have to erase it afterwards, but why does that small differences make her not qualified for being a true artist? She's a MAKE UP ARTIST, not some girl who hides her identity like your accusation in your comment. You saw her face without make up, and if you see her other videos, you would lost count on how many times she uploaded videos containing a scene of herself without any make up on. Now, a girl who painted her face to hide her identity wouldn't dare to do so, would she?

Everyone do most of the things in their lives to make themselves feel good. There's nothing wrong about feeling good, is there? Even you, expressing your opinion is an act to make yourself feel good, whether you realize it or not. You know that people, "feminists" might retaliate to your comment, but do you care? It's the same behaviour women have about make up. If we really care about what you might think if us, none of us would wear make up anymore, because I have seen a heckload lot of guys with the same opinion as you. Does that ever stop us from buying and wearing cosmetic? Nope, because make up does make women feel good. That's the truth, and I dont see anything shallow or wrong with it.

You relate make up as a tool of vanity, to cover insecurities. Guess what? I hate to break it down to you, but no one can run from insecurities and vanity. Not even you. Everyone has their own little things, it's inevitable. And if you said that you don't have anything you're insecure about, not one bit, you are lying, and that shows that you actually have bigger insecurities than half of the women who constantly watched make up tutorial videos. It's okay to be insecure sometimes, you're human, and as long as it doesn't get the best of you, insecurity is good to remind us that we have to keep trying to be a better person in life. It makes us go forward.

You said that make up is a form of oppression. Women wear make up to "attract mate", "increase social status", and feel good about themselves. Have you ever think of it this way: You are idealising women by saying that women who are confident, smart and already have a certain degree of social status are the women who dont wear make up. Isn't it some kind of oppression that you single-handedly drop upon us women?

Now, let's compare to the older era where women were treated like some kind of pretty object. Men expected women to always be pretty, obedient, to say only good and pretty stuff, and to smile and greeted them with a cup of coffee everyday. If you don't realize it already, I'm telling you that what you're doing is the same as what those sexist men did in the older days, the difference is that, men in the older days imposed and shaped their ideal women to be a pretty doll who were obedient and could take care of their house chores, and you imposed and shaped your ideal women as the one who don't wear make up.

This makes me wonder; how many smart, amazing and confident women have passed from your life just because you saw them in bright red lipstick and Marilyn Monroe make up she decided to try on after watching her movie rerun the other night?

Do you respect women? Of course, your answer is YES. You respect women. But sometimes I doubt that answer when it came from people like you, pigeon holing women according to their appearances. If you respect women as a whole, you would respect her when she decided that she wanted to be a little crazy today, and slap on some thick, vintage inspired make up as well as you respect her when she's not wearing her make up. That is called respecting a person for what she is, instead of go around and judging her based on her make up.

Try talking with some girls without judging them first. You wouldn't know if she was a smart, interesting person if you didn't talk to her. The saying "don't judge a book by its cover" doesn't always go to someone who wears shabby clothes, but also towards certain stereotypes/pigeon holes. If you stick to your stereotyping, judgmental manner, I'm afraid you have passed up a lot of chances to meet different kinds of interesting people and to broaden your views.

I hope that this goes into a consideration to a lot of men who think like JCM there. Feel free to rebut or whatever.
Wearing your underwear on the outside...very last millenium.

She's having fun with makeup.

Go girl.
People need to realize that Michelle Phan is a makeup ARTIST. Her use of dramatic lines and colors are merely art. The only difference is that they are painted on a face.

Sarah Leon, this is the funniest thing I have read in ages. Girl, keep it up. I love it!
Diana from San Francisco
Such a lovely and rare thing to see women of style instead of those that simply follow fashion. Bravo.

Why does your argument single out Republicans? I know of several prominent Democrats that oppose the Ground Zero Mosque- (yeah I said it). It also seems that a huge majority of the American public is against it. So, there you go again, being highly partisan. I could care less whether jidadists agree or disagree with my stance. You're arguing, as I take it,  that  we should placate the Jihadists first? So that they'll like us? Pathetic.

Oh lovely. Another leftist column calling Americans bigots and ignoramuses. The crusades were over eight hundred years ago. Today the 22 nations of the Islamic world fill their nation's media and textbooks with anti-Semitism. They treat their own religious minorities with vast contempt. They legalize homophobia and discrimination against women. They wage wars against Christians, Jews and schools.

With all due respect Mr. Kristoff many of us who dislike Islam, which is afterall nothing but a philosophy, have very good reasons for doing so. We have the right dislike to Islam in the same way as we dislike Republicanism or Democratic political candidates.

The mosque represents a world that many of us fear with very good reason. Dismissing our fears as nothing more than simple evil is insulting and condescending.

Your key recruiting theme is not real. They know we are the most tollerant people in the world already in this most Christian country the world has ever seen. That's why they come and go freely in the US. Their recruiting theme in reality is the same as Muhhamad's as written in the Koran, the biographies of Muhammad, and the traditions of Muhammad - we are non-believers and must be subjigated - Islam will be victorious and Sharia law will rule (not our constitution).
